conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows (A, B, C, and D) change in position and size when the light source moves to the right above the objects.

The light source will move to the right above the objects, maintaining its height but changing its horizontal position to be more or less above the right-hand pair (B and D).

When a light source moves horizontally, shadows shift in the opposite horizontal direction. The greater the horizontal distance between the light source and an object, the longer the shadow; the smaller the distance, the shorter the shadow.

premise: The light source moves horizontally to the right above the objects.
conclusion: The shadows of all objects will shift to the left of their respective objects.
